timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Will do. Should the native part of all these methods actually be on OsUser instead and what are the rationale for doing one over the other?
replies.author: rorbech

replies.bodyText:
So far we are using OsUser for all API's found on sync_user.hpp in ObjectStore.  refresh_custom_data is there as well, so should probably be there.
The primary reason for the split is that the Os<X> normally implements the NativeObject interface which we don't want in the public API, but it also allows us greater design flexibility in terms of how we expose the OS API.
It does have the downside there many methods are just "pass-through" though.
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Moved direct OS wrappers to OsSyncUser and kept the additional logic (returning user custom data after actual refresh) in User.
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.message: Support for custom user data refresh
Trying to rework import to avoid stale service references
